# Joe Stewart (rugby union)

| birth_place    = Boghill, Coleraine, Ireland

William Joseph Stewart (24 September 1900 — 1 February 1959) was an Irish international rugby union player.
Raised in Coleraine, County Londonderry, Stewart attended Coleraine Academical Institution and studied medicine at Queen's University Belfast. He was a fullback, capped 10 times for Ireland through the 1920s. His career career included a period in England, where he played for the Preston Grasshoppers and Lancashire.
Stewart, a doctor, worked in British India with the Indian Medical Service from 1933 until independence in 1947, then had a general practice for a number of years in the Lancashire district of Over Wyre.
